intro: Corispermum subpentandrum, commonly known as the five-stamen bladderwrack, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant thrives in moist, saline environments such as coastal areas and wetlands. Its reproductive structures include both male and female flowers, which are typically arranged in compact inflorescences. Corispermum subpentandrum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
